seg.desc: The handwriting is quite uniform, characterized by right-sloping rounded letters, with broad and thick shapes. It shows ancient features: the letters መ, ወ, with angular loops, ዐ ፀ with a triangular shape, ሎ sometimes with the loop attached to the body of the letter (see e.g. , ,); the numeral ፪ with the two loops attached (e.g, ); the numerals sometimes without the dashes above and below (e.g. ); coronis on (intercolumn) and on ; paragraphs signs and cues (numerals) for rubrication (e.g. ).
seg.seg: A few lines, alternating with black lines, on the incipit page of text 1.1 (), of text 1.2 () and of miracle 8 in text 1.2 (); 1-3 lines (sometimes alternating with black lines) on the incipit of the miracles 2, 3, 4, 6, 7; personal names in the supplication formulas; Ethiopic numerals or their elements; elements of the punctuation signs, paragraphs signs; coronis and/or their elements.

Image of Saint Gabra Krǝstos, the man of the Lord.
decoNote.note: The first legend is written (in red ink) in the upper part of the miniature, above the saint's figure); the second legend is written (yellow ink?) at the right side of the saint’s figure. The handwriting is most probably the same as the one of the main text.

The first legend, almost unreadable, is written (in black ink) at the left side, upper corner; the second, also incomplete, because mostly unreadable, is written (black ink) above (at the right side) the Mary's figure. Other legends (portions of legends) are completely unreadable. The handwriting looks recent, different from the one of the main text.

item.desc: The personal name ኆላዊ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ Ḫolāwi Krǝstos is written (in red ink) in the supplication formula on , at the explicit of miracle 1.

The personal name ሀብተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ Habta Śǝllāse is written (on the left margin, by a more recent hand) over another name originally written but not readable anymore (with the exception of the last letter, i.e. {n.l.}ን፡), in the supplication formula on , at the incipit of miracle 6.

list.item: The same name mentioned in the supplication formula on , at the incipit of miracle 1, has been also added in the supplication formula at the explicit of the miracle 6, on , written here as ሀብተ፡ ሥላሲ፡ Habta Śǝllāsi.
